imgs.text: Seawind II Cutter (Allied) drawing on sailboatdata.com

name: SEAWIND MK II CUTTER (ALLIED)
notes:
See SEAWIND MKII KETCH (ALLIED) for more details.
Updated vers. of Seawind 30. The Seawind II came to the market in 1975 as the successor to the original Seawind. Production of the Seabreeze, Luders, and Chance 30-30 was also stopped in favor of the Seawind II. A number of changes were made to the Seawind to form the Seawind II. It was over a foot longer, over a foot wider, carried 55 more square feet of sail area, and weighed an additional 2100 pounds.
